column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Met up at Lou's with a few friends for pizza Sunday night and overall we enjoyed our experience! For our group of 5
column2: we were initially told 45 minutes for the wait but were actually seated in just a few minutes which was a pleasant surprise. Even if you do have a long wait
column3: you can place your order so your pizza can begin to cook. (They take at least 30 minutes) We enjoyed a large deep dish with sausage and mushroom which was delicious. For dessert we shared a warm chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The only complaint we had was that the service was a bit slow. We had a hard time finding our waitress for napkins
column8: very nice to our group so perhaps her absence was due to the restaurant being short handed.
